sentences.english: Her Cupid-bow mouth pouted to give him an airy kiss.
sentences.chinese: 她那丘比特型的嘴一撅，像是要给他送一个飞吻。

sentences.english: I do so, father, and I send him my Soul with it!
sentences.chinese: 我要飞吻，父亲，我把灵魂也一起飞给他。

sentences.english: I gave my biggest smile and blew her a kiss.
sentences.chinese: 我还对她开怀大笑，并给她了她一个飞吻。

sentences.english: Give an air kiss to the person on your opposite.
sentences.chinese: 给坐在扑面的人一个飞吻。

sentences.english: He flew me a kiss when I said hello to him.
sentences.chinese: 我向他打招呼时，他给了我一个飞吻。

sentences.english: Then he blows you a kiss, gives you a little salute and walks away.
sentences.chinese: 然后他会给你一个飞吻和小小的敬礼，之后再走开。

sentences.english: She threw a kiss in Lucius' direction.
sentences.chinese: 她向卢修斯的方向送了一个飞吻。

definition: to throw amorous or flirtatious glances at sb (esp. of a woman)
to pull a face/to grimace/to scowl
(Internet slang) to form a hand heart using one's thumb and forefinger (or by using both hands)
to sway one's hips/to twist one's waist
to cast flirtatious glances at sb (idiom)
to cast flirtatious glances at sb (idiom)
to send one's greetings/to send best regards/to devote attention to
